Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can illustrate different types of living things in each habitat, such as plants (e.g., trees, grasses) and animals (e.g., lizards, fish).
The student can represent and label the variety of plants found in each habitat.
The student can represent and label the variety of animals found in each habitat.
The student can depict comparisons of plant and animal diversity between the two habitats through their drawings.
The student can show patterns in how different living things are distributed across the two habitats in their drawings.
